speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: For what I bid them do: for we bid this be done,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: When evil deeds have their permissive pass

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: And not the punishment. Therefore indeed, my father,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: I have on Angelo imposed the office;

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Who may, in the ambush of my name, strike home,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: And yet my nature never in the fight

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: To do in slander. And to behold his sway,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: I will, as 'twere a brother of your order,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Visit both prince and people: therefore, I prithee,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Supply me with the habit and instruct me

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: How I may formally in person bear me

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Like a true friar. More reasons for this action

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: At our more leisure shall I render you;

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Only, this one: Lord Angelo is precise;

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Stands at a guard with envy; scarce confesses

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: That his blood flows, or that his appetite

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Is more to bread than stone: hence shall we see,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: If power change purpose, what our seemers be.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: SCENE IV. A nunnery.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Enter ISABELLA and FRANCISCA

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And have you nuns no farther privileges?

speaker: FRANCISCA
text_entry: Are not these large enough?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Yes, truly; I speak not as desiring more;

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: But rather wishing a more strict restraint

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Upon the sisterhood, the votarists of Saint Clare.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: [Within]  Ho! Peace be in this place!

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Who's that which calls?

speaker: FRANCISCA
text_entry: It is a man's voice. Gentle Isabella,

speaker: FRANCISCA
text_entry: Turn you the key, and know his business of him;

speaker: FRANCISCA
text_entry: You may, I may not; you are yet unsworn.

speaker: FRANCISCA
text_entry: When you have vow'd, you must not speak with men

speaker: FRANCISCA
text_entry: But in the presence of the prioress:

speaker: FRANCISCA
text_entry: Then, if you speak, you must not show your face,

speaker: FRANCISCA
text_entry: Or, if you show your face, you must not speak.

speaker: FRANCISCA
text_entry: He calls again; I pray you, answer him.

speaker: FRANCISCA
text_entry: Exit

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Peace and prosperity! Who is't that calls

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Enter LUCIO

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Hail, virgin, if you be, as those cheek-roses

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Proclaim you are no less! Can you so stead me

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: As bring me to the sight of Isabella,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: A novice of this place and the fair sister

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: To her unhappy brother Claudio?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Why 'her unhappy brother'? let me ask,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: The rather for I now must make you know

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I am that Isabella and his sister.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Gentle and fair, your brother kindly greets you:

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Not to be weary with you, he's in prison.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Woe me! for what?

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: For that which, if myself might be his judge,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: He should receive his punishment in thanks:

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: He hath got his friend with child.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Sir, make me not your story.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: It is true.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: I would not--though 'tis my familiar sin

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: With maids to seem the lapwing and to jest,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Tongue far from heart--play with all virgins so:

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: I hold you as a thing ensky'd and sainted.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: By your renouncement an immortal spirit,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: And to be talk'd with in sincerity,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: As with a saint.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: You do blaspheme the good in mocking me.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Do not believe it. Fewness and truth, 'tis thus:

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Your brother and his lover have embraced:

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: As those that feed grow full, as blossoming time

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: That from the seedness the bare fallow brings

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: To teeming foison, even so her plenteous womb

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Expresseth his full tilth and husbandry.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Some one with child by him? My cousin Juliet?

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Is she your cousin?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Adoptedly; as school-maids change their names

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: By vain though apt affection.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: She it is.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: O, let him marry her.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: This is the point.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: The duke is very strangely gone from hence;

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Bore many gentlemen, myself being one,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: In hand and hope of action: but we do learn

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: By those that know the very nerves of state,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: His givings-out were of an infinite distance

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: From his true-meant design. Upon his place,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: And with full line of his authority,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Governs Lord Angelo; a man whose blood

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Is very snow-broth; one who never feels

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: The wanton stings and motions of the sense,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: But doth rebate and blunt his natural edge

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: With profits of the mind, study and fast.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: He--to give fear to use and liberty,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Which have for long run by the hideous law,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: As mice by lions--hath pick'd out an act,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Under whose heavy sense your brother's life

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Falls into forfeit: he arrests him on it;

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: And follows close the rigour of the statute,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: To make him an example. All hope is gone,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Unless you have the grace by your fair prayer

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: To soften Angelo: and that's my pith of business

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: 'Twixt you and your poor brother.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Doth he so seek his life?

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Has censured him

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Already; and, as I hear, the provost hath

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: A warrant for his execution.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Alas! what poor ability's in me

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: To do him good?

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Assay the power you have.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: My power? Alas, I doubt--

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Our doubts are traitors

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: And make us lose the good we oft might win

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: By fearing to attempt. Go to Lord Angelo,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: And let him learn to know, when maidens sue,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Men give like gods; but when they weep and kneel,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: All their petitions are as freely theirs

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: As they themselves would owe them.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I'll see what I can do.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: But speedily.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I will about it straight;

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: No longer staying but to give the mother

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Notice of my affair. I humbly thank you:

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Commend me to my brother: soon at night

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I'll send him certain word of my success.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: I take my leave of you.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Good sir, adieu.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: ACT II

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: SCENE I. A hall In ANGELO's house.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Enter ANGELO, ESCALUS, and a Justice, Provost, Officers, and other Attendants, behind

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: We must not make a scarecrow of the law,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Setting it up to fear the birds of prey,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And let it keep one shape, till custom make it

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Their perch and not their terror.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Ay, but yet

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Let us be keen, and rather cut a little,

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Than fall, and bruise to death. Alas, this gentleman

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Whom I would save, had a most noble father!

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Let but your honour know,

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Whom I believe to be most strait in virtue,

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: That, in the working of your own affections,

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Had time cohered with place or place with wishing,

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Or that the resolute acting of your blood

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Could have attain'd the effect of your own purpose,

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Whether you had not sometime in your life

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Err'd in this point which now you censure him,

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: And pull'd the law upon you.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: 'Tis one thing to be tempted, Escalus,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Another thing to fall. I not deny,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: The jury, passing on the prisoner's life,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: May in the sworn twelve have a thief or two

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Guiltier than him they try. What's open made to justice,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: That justice seizes: what know the laws

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: That thieves do pass on thieves? 'Tis very pregnant,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: The jewel that we find, we stoop and take't

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Because we see it; but what we do not see

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: We tread upon, and never think of it.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: You may not so extenuate his offence

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: For I have had such faults; but rather tell me,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: When I, that censure him, do so offend,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Let mine own judgment pattern out my death,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And nothing come in partial. Sir, he must die.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Be it as your wisdom will.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Where is the provost?

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Here, if it like your honour.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: See that Claudio

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Be executed by nine to-morrow morning:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Bring him his confessor, let him be prepared;

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: For that's the utmost of his pilgrimage.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Exit Provost

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: [Aside]  Well, heaven forgive him! and forgive us all!

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Some rise by sin, and some by virtue fall:

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Some run from brakes of ice, and answer none:

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: And some condemned for a fault alone.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Enter ELBOW, and Officers with FROTH and POMPEY

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: Come, bring them away: if these be good people in

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: a commonweal that do nothing but use their abuses in

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: common houses, I know no law: bring them away.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: How now, sir! What's your name? and what's the matter?

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: If it Please your honour, I am the poor duke's

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: constable, and my name is Elbow: I do lean upon

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: justice, sir, and do bring in here before your good

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: honour two notorious benefactors.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Benefactors? Well; what benefactors are they? are

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: they not malefactors?

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: If it? please your honour, I know not well what they

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: are: but precise villains they are, that I am sure

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: of; and void of all profanation in the world that

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: good Christians ought to have.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: This comes off well; here's a wise officer.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Go to: what quality are they of? Elbow is your

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: name? why dost thou not speak, Elbow?

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: He cannot, sir; he's out at elbow.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: What are you, sir?

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: He, sir! a tapster, sir; parcel-bawd; one that

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: serves a bad woman; whose house, sir, was, as they

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: say, plucked down in the suburbs; and now she

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: professes a hot-house, which, I think, is a very ill house too.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: How know you that?

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: My wife, sir, whom I detest before heaven and your honour,--

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: How? thy wife?

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: Ay, sir; whom, I thank heaven, is an honest woman,--

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Dost thou detest her therefore?

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: I say, sir, I will detest myself also, as well as

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: she, that this house, if it be not a bawd's house,

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: it is pity of her life, for it is a naughty house.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: How dost thou know that, constable?

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: Marry, sir, by my wife; who, if she had been a woman

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: cardinally given, might have been accused in

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: fornication, adultery, and all uncleanliness there.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: By the woman's means?

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: Ay, sir, by Mistress Overdone's means: but as she

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: spit in his face, so she defied him.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Sir, if it please your honour, this is not so.

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: Prove it before these varlets here, thou honourable

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: man; prove it.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Do you hear how he misplaces?

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Sir, she came in great with child; and longing,

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: saving your honour's reverence, for stewed prunes;

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: sir, we had but two in the house, which at that very

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: distant time stood, as it were, in a fruit-dish, a

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: dish of some three-pence; your honours have seen

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: such dishes; they are not China dishes, but very

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: good dishes,--

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Go to, go to: no matter for the dish, sir.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: No, indeed, sir, not of a pin; you are therein in

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: the right: but to the point. As I say, this

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Mistress Elbow, being, as I say, with child, and

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: being great-bellied, and longing, as I said, for

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: prunes; and having but two in the dish, as I said,

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Master Froth here, this very man, having eaten the

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: rest, as I said, and, as I say, paying for them very

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: honestly; for, as you know, Master Froth, I could

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: not give you three-pence again.

speaker: FROTH
text_entry: No, indeed.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Very well: you being then, if you be remembered,

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: cracking the stones of the foresaid prunes,--

speaker: FROTH
text_entry: Ay, so I did indeed.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Why, very well; I telling you then, if you be

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: remembered, that such a one and such a one were past

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: cure of the thing you wot of, unless they kept very

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: good diet, as I told you,--

speaker: FROTH
text_entry: All this is true.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Why, very well, then,--

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Come, you are a tedious fool: to the purpose. What

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: was done to Elbow's wife, that he hath cause to

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: complain of? Come me to what was done to her.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Sir, your honour cannot come to that yet.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: No, sir, nor I mean it not.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Sir, but you shall come to it, by your honour's

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: leave. And, I beseech you, look into Master Froth

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: here, sir; a man of four-score pound a year; whose

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: father died at Hallowmas: was't not at Hallowmas,

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Master Froth?

speaker: FROTH
text_entry: All-hallond eve.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Why, very well; I hope here be truths. He, sir,

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: sitting, as I say, in a lower chair, sir; 'twas in

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: the Bunch of Grapes, where indeed you have a delight

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: to sit, have you not?

speaker: FROTH
text_entry: I have so; because it is an open room and good for winter.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Why, very well, then; I hope here be truths.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: This will last out a night in Russia,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: When nights are longest there: I'll take my leave.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And leave you to the hearing of the cause;

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Hoping you'll find good cause to whip them all.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: I think no less. Good morrow to your lordship.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Exit ANGELO

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Now, sir, come on: what was done to Elbow's wife, once more?

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Once, sir? there was nothing done to her once.

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: I beseech you, sir, ask him what this man did to my wife.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: I beseech your honour, ask me.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Well, sir; what did this gentleman to her?

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: I beseech you, sir, look in this gentleman's face.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Good Master Froth, look upon his honour; 'tis for a

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: good purpose. Doth your honour mark his face?

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Ay, sir, very well.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Nay; I beseech you, mark it well.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Well, I do so.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Doth your honour see any harm in his face?

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Why, no.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: I'll be supposed upon a book, his face is the worst

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: thing about him. Good, then; if his face be the

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: worst thing about him, how could Master Froth do the

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: constable's wife any harm? I would know that of

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: your honour.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: He's in the right. Constable, what say you to it?

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: First, an it like you, the house is a respected

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: house; next, this is a respected fellow; and his

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: mistress is a respected woman.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: By this hand, sir, his wife is a more respected

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: person than any of us all.

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: Varlet, thou liest; thou liest, wicked varlet! the

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: time has yet to come that she was ever respected

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: with man, woman, or child.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Sir, she was respected with him before he married with her.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Which is the wiser here? Justice or Iniquity? Is

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: this true?

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: O thou caitiff! O thou varlet! O thou wicked

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: Hannibal! I respected with her before I was married

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: to her! If ever I was respected with her, or she

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: with me, let not your worship think me the poor

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: duke's officer. Prove this, thou wicked Hannibal, or

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: I'll have mine action of battery on thee.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: If he took you a box o' the ear, you might have your

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: action of slander too.

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: Marry, I thank your good worship for it. What is't

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: your worship's pleasure I shall do with this wicked caitiff?

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Truly, officer, because he hath some offences in him

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: that thou wouldst discover if thou couldst, let him

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: continue in his courses till thou knowest what they

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: are.

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: Marry, I thank your worship for it. Thou seest, thou

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: wicked varlet, now, what's come upon thee: thou art

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: to continue now, thou varlet; thou art to continue.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Where were you born, friend?

speaker: FROTH
text_entry: Here in Vienna, sir.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Are you of fourscore pounds a year?

speaker: FROTH
text_entry: Yes, an't please you, sir.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: So. What trade are you of, sir?

speaker: POMPHEY
text_entry: Tapster; a poor widow's tapster.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Your mistress' name?

speaker: POMPHEY
text_entry: Mistress Overdone.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Hath she had any more than one husband?

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Nine, sir; Overdone by the last.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Nine! Come hither to me, Master Froth. Master

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Froth, I would not have you acquainted with

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: tapsters: they will draw you, Master Froth, and you

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: will hang them. Get you gone, and let me hear no

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: more of you.

speaker: FROTH
text_entry: I thank your worship. For mine own part, I never

speaker: FROTH
text_entry: come into any room in a tap-house, but I am drawn

speaker: FROTH
text_entry: in.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Well, no more of it, Master Froth: farewell.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Exit FROTH

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Come you hither to me, Master tapster. What's your

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: name, Master tapster?

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Pompey.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: What else?

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Bum, sir.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Troth, and your bum is the greatest thing about you;

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: so that in the beastliest sense you are Pompey the

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Great. Pompey, you are partly a bawd, Pompey,

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: howsoever you colour it in being a tapster, are you

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: not? come, tell me true: it shall be the better for you.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Truly, sir, I am a poor fellow that would live.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: How would you live, Pompey? by being a bawd? What

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: do you think of the trade, Pompey? is it a lawful trade?

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: If the law would allow it, sir.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: But the law will not allow it, Pompey; nor it shall

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: not be allowed in Vienna.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Does your worship mean to geld and splay all the

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: youth of the city?

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: No, Pompey.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Truly, sir, in my poor opinion, they will to't then.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: If your worship will take order for the drabs and

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: the knaves, you need not to fear the bawds.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: There are pretty orders beginning, I can tell you:

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: it is but heading and hanging.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: If you head and hang all that offend that way but

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: for ten year together, you'll be glad to give out a

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: commission for more heads: if this law hold in

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Vienna ten year, I'll rent the fairest house in it

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: after three-pence a bay: if you live to see this

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: come to pass, say Pompey told you so.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Thank you, good Pompey; and, in requital of your

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: prophecy, hark you: I advise you, let me not find

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: you before me again upon any complaint whatsoever;

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: no, not for dwelling where you do: if I do, Pompey,

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: I shall beat you to your tent, and prove a shrewd

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Caesar to you; in plain dealing, Pompey, I shall

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: have you whipt: so, for this time, Pompey, fare you well.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: I thank your worship for your good counsel:

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Aside

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: but I shall follow it as the flesh and fortune shall

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: better determine.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Whip me? No, no; let carman whip his jade:

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: The valiant heart is not whipt out of his trade.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Exit

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Come hither to me, Master Elbow; come hither, Master

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: constable. How long have you been in this place of constable?

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: Seven year and a half, sir.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: I thought, by your readiness in the office, you had

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: continued in it some time. You say, seven years together?

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: And a half, sir.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Alas, it hath been great pains to you. They do you

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: wrong to put you so oft upon 't: are there not men

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: in your ward sufficient to serve it?

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: Faith, sir, few of any wit in such matters: as they

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: are chosen, they are glad to choose me for them; I

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: do it for some piece of money, and go through with

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: all.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Look you bring me in the names of some six or seven,

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: the most sufficient of your parish.

speaker: ELBOW
text_entry: To your worship's house, sir?

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: To my house. Fare you well.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Exit ELBOW

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: What's o'clock, think you?

speaker: Justice
text_entry: Eleven, sir.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: I pray you home to dinner with me.

speaker: Justice
text_entry: I humbly thank you.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: It grieves me for the death of Claudio;

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: But there's no remedy.

speaker: Justice
text_entry: Lord Angelo is severe.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: It is but needful:

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Mercy is not itself, that oft looks so;

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Pardon is still the nurse of second woe:

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: But yet,--poor Claudio! There is no remedy.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Come, sir.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: SCENE II. Another room in the same.

speaker: ESCALUS
text_entry: Enter Provost and a Servant

speaker: Servant
text_entry: He's hearing of a cause; he will come straight

speaker: Servant
text_entry: I'll tell him of you.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Pray you, do.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Exit Servant

speaker: Provost
text_entry: I'll know

speaker: Provost
text_entry: His pleasure; may be he will relent. Alas,

speaker: Provost
text_entry: He hath but as offended in a dream!

speaker: Provost
text_entry: All sects, all ages smack of this vice; and he

speaker: Provost
text_entry: To die for't!

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Enter ANGELO

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Now, what's the matter. Provost?

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Is it your will Claudio shall die tomorrow?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Did not I tell thee yea? hadst thou not order?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Why dost thou ask again?

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Lest I might be too rash:

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Under your good correction, I have seen,

speaker: Provost
text_entry: When, after execution, judgment hath

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Repented o'er his doom.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Go to; let that be mine:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Do you your office, or give up your place,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And you shall well be spared.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: I crave your honour's pardon.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: What shall be done, sir, with the groaning Juliet?

speaker: Provost
text_entry: She's very near her hour.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Dispose of her

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: To some more fitter place, and that with speed.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Re-enter Servant

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Here is the sister of the man condemn'd

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Desires access to you.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Hath he a sister?

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Ay, my good lord; a very virtuous maid,

speaker: Provost
text_entry: And to be shortly of a sisterhood,

speaker: Provost
text_entry: If not already.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Well, let her be admitted.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Exit Servant

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: See you the fornicatress be removed:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Let have needful, but not lavish, means;

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: There shall be order for't.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Enter ISABELLA and LUCIO

speaker: Provost
text_entry: God save your honour!

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Stay a little while.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: To ISABELLA

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: You're welcome: what's your will?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I am a woeful suitor to your honour,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Please but your honour hear me.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Well; what's your suit?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: There is a vice that most I do abhor,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And most desire should meet the blow of justice;

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: For which I would not plead, but that I must;

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: For which I must not plead, but that I am

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: At war 'twixt will and will not.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Well; the matter?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I have a brother is condemn'd to die:

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I do beseech you, let it be his fault,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And not my brother.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: [Aside]  Heaven give thee moving graces!

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Condemn the fault and not the actor of it?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Why, every fault's condemn'd ere it be done:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Mine were the very cipher of a function,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: To fine the faults whose fine stands in record,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And let go by the actor.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: O just but severe law!

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I had a brother, then. Heaven keep your honour!

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: [Aside to ISABELLA]  Give't not o'er so: to him

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: again, entreat him;

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Kneel down before him, hang upon his gown:

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: You are too cold; if you should need a pin,

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: You could not with more tame a tongue desire it:

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: To him, I say!

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Must he needs die?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Maiden, no remedy.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Yes; I do think that you might pardon him,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And neither heaven nor man grieve at the mercy.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: I will not do't.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: But can you, if you would?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Look, what I will not, that I cannot do.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: But might you do't, and do the world no wrong,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: If so your heart were touch'd with that remorse

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: A s mine is to him?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: He's sentenced; 'tis too late.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: [Aside to ISABELLA]  You are too cold.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Too late? why, no; I, that do speak a word.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: May call it back again. Well, believe this,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: No ceremony that to great ones 'longs,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Not the king's crown, nor the deputed sword,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: The marshal's truncheon, nor the judge's robe,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Become them with one half so good a grace

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: As mercy does.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: If he had been as you and you as he,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: You would have slipt like him; but he, like you,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Would not have been so stern.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Pray you, be gone.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I would to heaven I had your potency,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And you were Isabel! should it then be thus?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: No; I would tell what 'twere to be a judge,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And what a prisoner.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: [Aside to ISABELLA]

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Ay, touch him; there's the vein.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Your brother is a forfeit of the law,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And you but waste your words.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Alas, alas!

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Why, all the souls that were were forfeit once;

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And He that might the vantage best have took

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Found out the remedy. How would you be,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: If He, which is the top of judgment, should

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: But judge you as you are? O, think on that;

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And mercy then will breathe within your lips,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Like man new made.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Be you content, fair maid;

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: It is the law, not I condemn your brother:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Were he my kinsman, brother, or my son,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: It should be thus with him: he must die tomorrow.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: To-morrow! O, that's sudden! Spare him, spare him!

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: He's not prepared for death. Even for our kitchens

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: We kill the fowl of season: shall we serve heaven

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: With less respect than we do minister

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: To our gross selves? Good, good my lord, bethink you;

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Who is it that hath died for this offence?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: There's many have committed it.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: [Aside to ISABELLA]           Ay, well said.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: The law hath not been dead, though it hath slept:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Those many had not dared to do that evil,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: If the first that did the edict infringe

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Had answer'd for his deed: now 'tis awake

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Takes note of what is done; and, like a prophet,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Looks in a glass, that shows what future evils,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Either new, or by remissness new-conceived,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And so in progress to be hatch'd and born,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Are now to have no successive degrees,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: But, ere they live, to end.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Yet show some pity.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: I show it most of all when I show justice;

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: For then I pity those I do not know,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Which a dismiss'd offence would after gall;

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And do him right that, answering one foul wrong,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Lives not to act another. Be satisfied;

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Your brother dies to-morrow; be content.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: So you must be the first that gives this sentence,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And he, that suffer's. O, it is excellent

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: To have a giant's strength; but it is tyrannous

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: To use it like a giant.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: [Aside to ISABELLA]   That's well said.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Could great men thunder

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: As Jove himself does, Jove would ne'er be quiet,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: For every pelting, petty officer

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Would use his heaven for thunder;

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Nothing but thunder! Merciful Heaven,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Thou rather with thy sharp and sulphurous bolt

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Split'st the unwedgeable and gnarled oak

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Than the soft myrtle: but man, proud man,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Drest in a little brief authority,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Most ignorant of what he's most assured,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: His glassy essence, like an angry ape,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Plays such fantastic tricks before high heaven

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: As make the angels weep; who, with our spleens,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Would all themselves laugh mortal.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: [Aside to ISABELLA]  O, to him, to him, wench! he

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: will relent;

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: He's coming; I perceive 't.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: [Aside]  Pray heaven she win him!

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: We cannot weigh our brother with ourself:

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Great men may jest with saints; 'tis wit in them,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: But in the less foul profanation.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: Thou'rt i' the right, girl; more o, that.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: That in the captain's but a choleric word,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Which in the soldier is flat blasphemy.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: [Aside to ISABELLA]  Art avised o' that? more on 't.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Why do you put these sayings upon me?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Because authority, though it err like others,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Hath yet a kind of medicine in itself,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: That skins the vice o' the top. Go to your bosom;

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Knock there, and ask your heart what it doth know

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: That's like my brother's fault: if it confess

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: A natural guiltiness such as is his,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Let it not sound a thought upon your tongue

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Against my brother's life.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: [Aside]                  She speaks, and 'tis

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Such sense, that my sense breeds with it. Fare you well.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Gentle my lord, turn back.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: I will bethink me: come again tomorrow.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Hark how I'll bribe you: good my lord, turn back.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: How! bribe me?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Ay, with such gifts that heaven shall share with you.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: [Aside to ISABELLA]  You had marr'd all else.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Not with fond shekels of the tested gold,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Or stones whose rates are either rich or poor

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: As fancy values them; but with true prayers

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: That shall be up at heaven and enter there

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Ere sun-rise, prayers from preserved souls,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: From fasting maids whose minds are dedicate

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: To nothing temporal.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Well; come to me to-morrow.

speaker: LUCIO
text_entry: [Aside to ISABELLA]  Go to; 'tis well; away!

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Heaven keep your honour safe!

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: [Aside] Amen:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: For I am that way going to temptation,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Where prayers cross.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: At what hour to-morrow

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Shall I attend your lordship?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: At any time 'fore noon.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: 'Save your honour!

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Exeunt ISABELLA, LUCIO, and Provost

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: From thee, even from thy virtue!

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: What's this, what's this? Is this her fault or mine?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: The tempter or the tempted, who sins most?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Ha!

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Not she: nor doth she tempt: but it is I

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: That, lying by the violet in the sun,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Do as the carrion does, not as the flower,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Corrupt with virtuous season. Can it be

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: That modesty may more betray our sense

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Than woman's lightness? Having waste ground enough,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Shall we desire to raze the sanctuary

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And pitch our evils there? O, fie, fie, fie!

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: What dost thou, or what art thou, Angelo?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Dost thou desire her foully for those things

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: That make her good? O, let her brother live!

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Thieves for their robbery have authority

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: When judges steal themselves. What, do I love her,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: That I desire to hear her speak again,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And feast upon her eyes? What is't I dream on?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: O cunning enemy, that, to catch a saint,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: With saints dost bait thy hook! Most dangerous

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Is that temptation that doth goad us on

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: To sin in loving virtue: never could the strumpet,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: With all her double vigour, art and nature,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Once stir my temper; but this virtuous maid

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Subdues me quite. Even till now,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: When men were fond, I smiled and wonder'd how.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: SCENE III. A room in a prison.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Enter, severally, DUKE VINCENTIO disguised as a friar, and Provost

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Hail to you, provost! so I think you are.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: I am the provost. What's your will, good friar?

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Bound by my charity and my blest order,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: I come to visit the afflicted spirits

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Here in the prison. Do me the common right

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: To let me see them and to make me know

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: The nature of their crimes, that I may minister

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: To them accordingly.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: I would do more than that, if more were needful.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Enter JULIET

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Look, here comes one: a gentlewoman of mine,

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Who, falling in the flaws of her own youth,

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Hath blister'd her report: she is with child;

speaker: Provost
text_entry: And he that got it, sentenced; a young man

speaker: Provost
text_entry: More fit to do another such offence

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Than die for this.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: When must he die?

speaker: Provost
text_entry: As I do think, to-morrow.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: I have provided for you: stay awhile,

speaker: Provost
text_entry: To JULIET

speaker: Provost
text_entry: And you shall be conducted.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Repent you, fair one, of the sin you carry?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: I do; and bear the shame most patiently.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: I'll teach you how you shall arraign your conscience,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: And try your penitence, if it be sound,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Or hollowly put on.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: I'll gladly learn.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Love you the man that wrong'd you?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Yes, as I love the woman that wrong'd him.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: So then it seems your most offenceful act

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Was mutually committed?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Mutually.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Then was your sin of heavier kind than his.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: I do confess it, and repent it, father.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: 'Tis meet so, daughter: but lest you do repent,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: As that the sin hath brought you to this shame,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Which sorrow is always towards ourselves, not heaven,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Showing we would not spare heaven as we love it,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: But as we stand in fear,--

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: I do repent me, as it is an evil,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: And take the shame with joy.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: There rest.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Your partner, as I hear, must die to-morrow,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: And I am going with instruction to him.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Grace go with you, Benedicite!

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Must die to-morrow! O injurious love,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: That respites me a life, whose very comfort

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Is still a dying horror!

speaker: Provost
text_entry: 'Tis pity of him.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: Provost
text_entry: SCENE IV. A room in ANGELO's house.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Enter ANGELO

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: When I would pray and think, I think and pray

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: To several subjects. Heaven hath my empty words;

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Whilst my invention, hearing not my tongue,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Anchors on Isabel: Heaven in my mouth,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: As if I did but only chew his name;

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And in my heart the strong and swelling evil

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Of my conception. The state, whereon I studied

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Is like a good thing, being often read,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Grown fear'd and tedious; yea, my gravity,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Wherein--let no man hear me--I take pride,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Could I with boot change for an idle plume,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Which the air beats for vain. O place, O form,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: How often dost thou with thy case, thy habit,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Wrench awe from fools and tie the wiser souls

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: To thy false seeming! Blood, thou art blood:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Let's write good angel on the devil's horn:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: 'Tis not the devil's crest.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Enter a Servant

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: How now! who's there?

speaker: Servant
text_entry: One Isabel, a sister, desires access to you.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Teach her the way.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Exit Servant

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: O heavens!

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Why does my blood thus muster to my heart,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Making both it unable for itself,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And dispossessing all my other parts

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Of necessary fitness?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: So play the foolish throngs with one that swoons;

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Come all to help him, and so stop the air

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: By which he should revive: and even so

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: The general, subject to a well-wish'd king,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Quit their own part, and in obsequious fondness

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Crowd to his presence, where their untaught love

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Must needs appear offence.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Enter ISABELLA

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: How now, fair maid?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I am come to know your pleasure.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: That you might know it, would much better please me

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Than to demand what 'tis. Your brother cannot live.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Even so. Heaven keep your honour!

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Yet may he live awhile; and, it may be,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: As long as you or I yet he must die.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Under your sentence?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Yea.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: When, I beseech you? that in his reprieve,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Longer or shorter, he may be so fitted

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: That his soul sicken not.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Ha! fie, these filthy vices! It were as good

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: To pardon him that hath from nature stolen

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: A man already made, as to remit

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Their saucy sweetness that do coin heaven's image

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: In stamps that are forbid: 'tis all as easy

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Falsely to take away a life true made

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: As to put metal in restrained means

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: To make a false one.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: 'Tis set down so in heaven, but not in earth.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Say you so? then I shall pose you quickly.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Which had you rather, that the most just law

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Now took your brother's life; or, to redeem him,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Give up your body to such sweet uncleanness

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: As she that he hath stain'd?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Sir, believe this,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I had rather give my body than my soul.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: I talk not of your soul: our compell'd sins

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Stand more for number than for accompt.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: How say you?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Nay, I'll not warrant that; for I can speak

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Against the thing I say. Answer to this:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: I, now the voice of the recorded law,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Pronounce a sentence on your brother's life:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Might there not be a charity in sin

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: To save this brother's life?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Please you to do't,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I'll take it as a peril to my soul,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: It is no sin at all, but charity.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Pleased you to do't at peril of your soul,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Were equal poise of sin and charity.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: That I do beg his life, if it be sin,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Heaven let me bear it! you granting of my suit,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: If that be sin, I'll make it my morn prayer

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: To have it added to the faults of mine,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And nothing of your answer.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Nay, but hear me.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Your sense pursues not mine: either you are ignorant,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Or seem so craftily; and that's not good.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Let me be ignorant, and in nothing good,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: But graciously to know I am no better.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Thus wisdom wishes to appear most bright

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: When it doth tax itself; as these black masks

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Proclaim an enshield beauty ten times louder

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Than beauty could, display'd. But mark me;

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: To be received plain, I'll speak more gross:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Your brother is to die.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: So.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And his offence is so, as it appears,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Accountant to the law upon that pain.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: True.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Admit no other way to save his life,--

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: As I subscribe not that, nor any other,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: But in the loss of question,--that you, his sister,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Finding yourself desired of such a person,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Whose credit with the judge, or own great place,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Could fetch your brother from the manacles

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Of the all-building law; and that there were

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: No earthly mean to save him, but that either

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: You must lay down the treasures of your body

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: To this supposed, or else to let him suffer;

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: What would you do?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: As much for my poor brother as myself:

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: That is, were I under the terms of death,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: The impression of keen whips I'ld wear as rubies,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And strip myself to death, as to a bed

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: That longing have been sick for, ere I'ld yield

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: My body up to shame.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Then must your brother die.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And 'twere the cheaper way:

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Better it were a brother died at once,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Than that a sister, by redeeming him,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Should die for ever.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Were not you then as cruel as the sentence

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: That you have slander'd so?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Ignomy in ransom and free pardon

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Are of two houses: lawful mercy

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Is nothing kin to foul redemption.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: You seem'd of late to make the law a tyrant;

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And rather proved the sliding of your brother

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: A merriment than a vice.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: O, pardon me, my lord; it oft falls out,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: To have what we would have, we speak not what we mean:

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I something do excuse the thing I hate,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: For his advantage that I dearly love.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: We are all frail.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Else let my brother die,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: If not a feodary, but only he

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Owe and succeed thy weakness.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Nay, women are frail too.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Ay, as the glasses where they view themselves;

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Which are as easy broke as they make forms.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Women! Help Heaven! men their creation mar

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: In profiting by them. Nay, call us ten times frail;

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: For we are soft as our complexions are,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And credulous to false prints.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: I think it well:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And from this testimony of your own sex,--

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Since I suppose we are made to be no stronger

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Than faults may shake our frames,--let me be bold;

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: I do arrest your words. Be that you are,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: That is, a woman; if you be more, you're none;

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: If you be one, as you are well express'd

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: By all external warrants, show it now,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: By putting on the destined livery.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I have no tongue but one: gentle my lord,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Let me entreat you speak the former language.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Plainly conceive, I love you.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: My brother did love Juliet,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And you tell me that he shall die for it.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: He shall not, Isabel, if you give me love.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I know your virtue hath a licence in't,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Which seems a little fouler than it is,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: To pluck on others.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Believe me, on mine honour,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: My words express my purpose.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Ha! little honour to be much believed,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And most pernicious purpose! Seeming, seeming!

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I will proclaim thee, Angelo; look for't:

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Sign me a present pardon for my brother,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Or with an outstretch'd throat I'll tell the world aloud

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: What man thou art.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Who will believe thee, Isabel?

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: My unsoil'd name, the austereness of my life,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: My vouch against you, and my place i' the state,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Will so your accusation overweigh,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: That you shall stifle in your own report

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And smell of calumny. I have begun,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: And now I give my sensual race the rein:

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Fit thy consent to my sharp appetite;

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Lay by all nicety and prolixious blushes,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: That banish what they sue for; redeem thy brother

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: By yielding up thy body to my will;

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Or else he must not only die the death,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: But thy unkindness shall his death draw out

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: To lingering sufferance. Answer me to-morrow,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Or, by the affection that now guides me most,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: I'll prove a tyrant to him. As for you,

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Say what you can, my false o'erweighs your true.

speaker: ANGELO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: To whom should I complain? Did I tell this,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Who would believe me? O perilous mouths,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: That bear in them one and the self-same tongue,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Either of condemnation or approof;

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Bidding the law make court'sy to their will:

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Hooking both right and wrong to the appetite,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: To follow as it draws! I'll to my brother:

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Though he hath fallen by prompture of the blood,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Yet hath he in him such a mind of honour.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: That, had he twenty heads to tender down

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: On twenty bloody blocks, he'ld yield them up,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Before his sister should her body stoop

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: To such abhorr'd pollution.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Then, Isabel, live chaste, and, brother, die:

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: More than our brother is our chastity.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I'll tell him yet of Angelo's request,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And fit his mind to death, for his soul's rest.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Exit

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: ACT III

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: SCENE I. A room in the prison.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Enter DUKE VINCENTIO disguised as before, CLAUDIO, and Provost

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: So then you hope of pardon from Lord Angelo?

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: The miserable have no other medicine

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: But only hope:

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: I've hope to live, and am prepared to die.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Be absolute for death; either death or life

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Shall thereby be the sweeter. Reason thus with life:

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: If I do lose thee, I do lose a thing

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: That none but fools would keep: a breath thou art,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Servile to all the skyey influences,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: That dost this habitation, where thou keep'st,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Hourly afflict: merely, thou art death's fool;

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: For him thou labour'st by thy flight to shun

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: And yet runn'st toward him still. Thou art not noble;

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: For all the accommodations that thou bear'st

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Are nursed by baseness. Thou'rt by no means valiant;

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: For thou dost fear the soft and tender fork

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Of a poor worm. Thy best of rest is sleep,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: And that thou oft provokest; yet grossly fear'st

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Thy death, which is no more. Thou art not thyself;

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: For thou exist'st on many a thousand grains

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: That issue out of dust. Happy thou art not;

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: For what thou hast not, still thou strivest to get,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: And what thou hast, forget'st. Thou art not certain;

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: For thy complexion shifts to strange effects,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: After the moon. If thou art rich, thou'rt poor;

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: For, like an ass whose back with ingots bows,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Thou bear's thy heavy riches but a journey,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: And death unloads thee. Friend hast thou none;

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: For thine own bowels, which do call thee sire,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: The mere effusion of thy proper loins,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Do curse the gout, serpigo, and the rheum,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: For ending thee no sooner. Thou hast nor youth nor age,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: But, as it were, an after-dinner's sleep,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Dreaming on both; for all thy blessed youth

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Becomes as aged, and doth beg the alms

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Of palsied eld; and when thou art old and rich,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Thou hast neither heat, affection, limb, nor beauty,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: To make thy riches pleasant. What's yet in this

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: That bears the name of life? Yet in this life

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Lie hid moe thousand deaths: yet death we fear,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: That makes these odds all even.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: I humbly thank you.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: To sue to live, I find I seek to die;

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: And, seeking death, find life: let it come on.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: [Within]  What, ho! Peace here; grace and good company!

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Who's there? come in: the wish deserves a welcome.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Dear sir, ere long I'll visit you again.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: Most holy sir, I thank you.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: Enter ISABELLA

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: My business is a word or two with Claudio.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: And very welcome. Look, signior, here's your sister.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Provost, a word with you.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: As many as you please.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Bring me to hear them speak, where I may be concealed.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Exeunt DUKE VINCENTIO and Provost

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: Now, sister, what's the comfort?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Why,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: As all comforts are; most good, most good indeed.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Lord Angelo, having affairs to heaven,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Intends you for his swift ambassador,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Where you shall be an everlasting leiger:

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Therefore your best appointment make with speed;

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: To-morrow you set on.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: Is there no remedy?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: None, but such remedy as, to save a head,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: To cleave a heart in twain.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: But is there any?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Yes, brother, you may live:

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: There is a devilish mercy in the judge,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: If you'll implore it, that will free your life,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: But fetter you till death.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: Perpetual durance?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Ay, just; perpetual durance, a restraint,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Though all the world's vastidity you had,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: To a determined scope.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: But in what nature?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: In such a one as, you consenting to't,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Would bark your honour from that trunk you bear,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And leave you naked.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: Let me know the point.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: O, I do fear thee, Claudio; and I quake,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Lest thou a feverous life shouldst entertain,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And six or seven winters more respect

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Than a perpetual honour. Darest thou die?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: The sense of death is most in apprehension;

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And the poor beetle, that we tread upon,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: In corporal sufferance finds a pang as great

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: As when a giant dies.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: Why give you me this shame?

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: Think you I can a resolution fetch

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: From flowery tenderness? If I must die,

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: I will encounter darkness as a bride,

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: And hug it in mine arms.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: There spake my brother; there my father's grave

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Did utter forth a voice. Yes, thou must die:

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Thou art too noble to conserve a life

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: In base appliances. This outward-sainted deputy,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Whose settled visage and deliberate word

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Nips youth i' the head and follies doth emmew

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: As falcon doth the fowl, is yet a devil

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: His filth within being cast, he would appear

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: A pond as deep as hell.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: The prenzie Angelo!

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: O, 'tis the cunning livery of hell,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: The damned'st body to invest and cover

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: In prenzie guards! Dost thou think, Claudio?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: If I would yield him my virginity,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Thou mightst be freed.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: O heavens! it cannot be.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Yes, he would give't thee, from this rank offence,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: So to offend him still. This night's the time

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: That I should do what I abhor to name,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Or else thou diest to-morrow.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: Thou shalt not do't.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: O, were it but my life,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I'ld throw it down for your deliverance

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: As frankly as a pin.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: Thanks, dear Isabel.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Be ready, Claudio, for your death tomorrow.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: Yes. Has he affections in him,

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: That thus can make him bite the law by the nose,

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: When he would force it? Sure, it is no sin,

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: Or of the deadly seven, it is the least.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Which is the least?

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: If it were damnable, he being so wise,

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: Why would he for the momentary trick

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: Be perdurably fined? O Isabel!

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: What says my brother?

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: Death is a fearful thing.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: And shamed life a hateful.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: Ay, but to die, and go we know not where;

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: To lie in cold obstruction and to rot;

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: This sensible warm motion to become

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: A kneaded clod; and the delighted spirit

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: To bathe in fiery floods, or to reside

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: In thrilling region of thick-ribbed ice;

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: To be imprison'd in the viewless winds,

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: And blown with restless violence round about

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: The pendent world; or to be worse than worst

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: Of those that lawless and incertain thought

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: Imagine howling: 'tis too horrible!

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: The weariest and most loathed worldly life

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: That age, ache, penury and imprisonment

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: Can lay on nature is a paradise

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: To what we fear of death.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Alas, alas!

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: Sweet sister, let me live:

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: What sin you do to save a brother's life,

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: Nature dispenses with the deed so far

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: That it becomes a virtue.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: O you beast!

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: O faithless coward! O dishonest wretch!

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Wilt thou be made a man out of my vice?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Is't not a kind of incest, to take life

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: From thine own sister's shame? What should I think?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Heaven shield my mother play'd my father fair!

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: For such a warped slip of wilderness

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Ne'er issued from his blood. Take my defiance!

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Die, perish! Might but my bending down

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Reprieve thee from thy fate, it should proceed:

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I'll pray a thousand prayers for thy death,

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: No word to save thee.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: Nay, hear me, Isabel.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: O, fie, fie, fie!

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Thy sin's not accidental, but a trade.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Mercy to thee would prove itself a bawd:

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: 'Tis best thou diest quickly.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: O hear me, Isabella!

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: Re-enter DUKE VINCENTIO

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Vouchsafe a word, young sister, but one word.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: What is your will?

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Might you dispense with your leisure, I would by and

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: by have some speech with you: the satisfaction I

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: would require is likewise your own benefit.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I have no superfluous leisure; my stay must be

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: stolen out of other affairs; but I will attend you awhile.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Walks apart

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Son, I have overheard what hath passed between you

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: and your sister. Angelo had never the purpose to

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: corrupt her; only he hath made an essay of her

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: virtue to practise his judgment with the disposition

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: of natures: she, having the truth of honour in her,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: hath made him that gracious denial which he is most

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: glad to receive. I am confessor to Angelo, and I

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: know this to be true; therefore prepare yourself to

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: death: do not satisfy your resolution with hopes

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: that are fallible: tomorrow you must die; go to

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: your knees and make ready.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: Let me ask my sister pardon. I am so out of love

speaker: CLAUDIO
text_entry: with life that I will sue to be rid of it.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Hold you there: farewell.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Exit CLAUDIO

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Provost, a word with you!

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Re-enter Provost

speaker: Provost
text_entry: What's your will, father

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: That now you are come, you will be gone. Leave me

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: awhile with the maid: my mind promises with my

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: habit no loss shall touch her by my company.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: In good time.

speaker: Provost
text_entry: Exit Provost. ISABELLA comes forward

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: The hand that hath made you fair hath made you good:

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: the goodness that is cheap in beauty makes beauty

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: brief in goodness; but grace, being the soul of

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: your complexion, shall keep the body of it ever

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: fair. The assault that Angelo hath made to you,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: fortune hath conveyed to my understanding; and, but

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: that frailty hath examples for his falling, I should

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: wonder at Angelo. How will you do to content this

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: substitute, and to save your brother?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I am now going to resolve him: I had rather my

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: brother die by the law than my son should be

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: unlawfully born. But, O, how much is the good duke

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: deceived in Angelo! If ever he return and I can

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: speak to him, I will open my lips in vain, or

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: discover his government.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: That shall not be much amiss: Yet, as the matter

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: now stands, he will avoid your accusation; he made

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: trial of you only. Therefore fasten your ear on my

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: advisings: to the love I have in doing good a

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: remedy presents itself. I do make myself believe

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: that you may most uprighteously do a poor wronged

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: lady a merited benefit; redeem your brother from

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: the angry law; do no stain to your own gracious

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: person; and much please the absent duke, if

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: peradventure he shall ever return to have hearing of

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: this business.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Let me hear you speak farther. I have spirit to do

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: anything that appears not foul in the truth of my spirit.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Virtue is bold, and goodness never fearful. Have

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: you not heard speak of Mariana, the sister of

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Frederick the great soldier who miscarried at sea?

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: I have heard of the lady, and good words went with her name.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: She should this Angelo have married; was affianced

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: to her by oath, and the nuptial appointed: between

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: which time of the contract and limit of the

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: solemnity, her brother Frederick was wrecked at sea,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: having in that perished vessel the dowry of his

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: sister. But mark how heavily this befell to the

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: poor gentlewoman: there she lost a noble and

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: renowned brother, in his love toward her ever most

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: kind and natural; with him, the portion and sinew of

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: her fortune, her marriage-dowry; with both, her

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: combinate husband, this well-seeming Angelo.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Can this be so? did Angelo so leave her?

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: Left her in her tears, and dried not one of them

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: with his comfort; swallowed his vows whole,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: pretending in her discoveries of dishonour: in few,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: bestowed her on her own lamentation, which she yet

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: wears for his sake; and he, a marble to her tears,

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: is washed with them, but relents not.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: What a merit were it in death to take this poor maid

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: from the world! What corruption in this life, that

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: it will let this man live! But how out of this can she avail?

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: It is a rupture that you may easily heal: and the

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: cure of it not only saves your brother, but keeps

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
text_entry: you from dishonour in doing it.

speaker: ISABELLA
text_entry: Show me how, good father.

speaker: DUKE VINCENTIO
